Coimbatore is set to receive a massive new library and science center, expected to be named the Kalaignar Centenary Library.  Located on the grounds of the Coimbatore Central Prison near the Gandhipuram town bus stand, the facility will occupy 1,98,000 sq. ft. across seven floors and span 6.98 acres.  

The project, costing ₹300 crore, will be funded by the Tamil Nadu government and executed by the Public Works Department (PWD). Of the total cost, ₹245 crore is allocated for construction and electrical works, while ₹50 crore is earmarked for procuring books and e-books. Another ₹5 crore will be allocated for IT infrastructure and equipment.

This comprehensive resource hub aims to serve students, researchers, and individuals with disabilities. It will feature an auditorium, a science center, a children’s library, and a competitive exam preparation library, along with sections for Tamil and English literature.  The facility will also include specialized resources for differently-abled users and incubation centers to nurture start-ups and MSMEs.

The tender process is scheduled to begin on October 16, 2024, with completion expected by January 2026. The project is a significant investment in education and knowledge infrastructure for Coimbatore.

title: Former Indian Minister Geetha Reddy Honored with Rajiv Gandhi Sadbhavana Award
news:
Veteran Congress leader and former Minister J. Geetha Reddy will be awarded the Rajiv Gandhi Sadbhavana Award on October 19th, 2024. The award will be presented at the historic Charminar in Hyderabad, India, during the 34th Rajiv Gandhi Sadbhvana Yatra Commemoration Day.

The award commemorates the legacy of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi who began his Sadbhvana Yatra from the Charminar on October 19th, 1990.  The Rajiv Gandhi Sadbhvana Yatra Commemoration Committee has been observing this day annually for the past 34 years.

Geetha Reddy was chosen by a panel consisting of B. Kamalakar Rao and A. Shyam Mohan, who praised her contributions to public service. The award ceremony will feature several prominent figures, including TPCC president Mahesh Kumar Goud, Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy, and Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka.

Past recipients of the Sadbhavana award include notable figures such as K. Rosaiah, Veerappa Moily, and Ghulam Nabi Azad.

title: Kerala HC Orders SIT Probe into Drug and Alcohol Abuse in Malayalam Film Industry
news:
The Kerala High Court has directed the Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate allegations of widespread drug and alcohol use in the Malayalam film industry. This follows the findings of the K. Hema Committee report which highlighted rampant substance abuse on film sets and related workplaces.

The court emphasized that while the SIT should take necessary steps to prevent such abuse, there should be no coercion of witnesses in the investigation. This aligns with the court's previous directive to treat statements from the K. Hema Committee report as “information” under the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023 (BNSS).

The court further mandated that the SIT ensure the confidentiality of victims/survivors, masking their names in all official documents and preventing the public release of any information that could compromise their identities. 

While the SIT has indicated that witnesses from the K. Hema Committee report are unwilling to cooperate, the court stressed that appropriate actions under the BNSS should be taken to ensure that the investigation proceeds fairly.

title: Tangedco Official and Contractor Arrested for Bribery
news:
A Tangedco official and an EB contractor were arrested in Thanjavur, India, on October 14th, 2024, for allegedly demanding and accepting a bribe. 

Manikandan, an EB Revenue Supervisor, and Sudhakar, an EB contractor, were apprehended by the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) after a complaint was filed by a resident named Balamurugan. 

Balamurugan had applied to change the tariff category of his domestic power connection from commercial to normal domestic. Manikandan, the Revenue Supervisor, allegedly demanded ₹2,000 to process the change. 

The DVAC set up a trap, providing Balamurugan with chemically-coated currency notes. When Manikandan directed Balamurugan to give the money to Sudhakar, the DVAC officials apprehended both individuals. 

Both Manikandan and Sudhakar were produced before a court in Kumbakonam and remanded in judicial custody.

title: Hezbollah Airs Slain Leader's Message After Drone Strikes on Israel
news:
Hezbollah, the Iran-backed militant group, has aired an audio recording of its deceased leader, Hassan Nasrallah, following a series of drone strikes on Israel.  Nasrallah, assassinated in a September 27th Israeli airstrike, is heard urging fighters to "defend your people, your families, your nation, your values and your dignity, and to defend this holy and blessed land and this honourable people."

This audio message, delivered during a military maneuver, comes amidst heightened tensions between Israel and Hezbollah. The group claims to have launched drones against an Israeli military training base in Binyamina, killing four Israeli soldiers.  This attack is seen as retaliation for Israeli airstrikes on Thursday, which killed at least 22 people in Beirut.

Hezbollah has escalated its attacks against Israel since late September, firing rockets and drones into the country in support of Hamas militants in Gaza.  Israel has retaliated with airstrikes and ground operations targeting Hezbollah facilities and fighters.

title: Israel Exposes Hezbollah Tunnel Near UN Post
news:
The Israeli army showcased a Hezbollah tunnel located just 200 meters from a UN peacekeeping post in southern Lebanon. The tunnel's presence, according to Israel, violates UN Resolution 1701 which aims to prevent armed groups from operating near the border. 

During the media tour, the Israeli army displayed ammunition and an Iranian-made improvised explosive device (IED) linked to Hezbollah. 

The UN has expressed concern as Israeli tanks entered a peacekeeping area.  Hezbollah allegedly responded with fire, resulting in 25 Israeli soldiers being injured.  

Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu has called for the withdrawal of UN peacekeepers from areas controlled by Hezbollah, citing concerns that they could be used as human shields.

title: SIDBI Expands Reach in Tamil Nadu with New Branch in Tiruchi
news:
The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) opened its 13th branch in Tamil Nadu on Monday, located in Tiruchi. The branch will serve the MSME cluster in and around Tiruchi, including the significant jewellery industry. 

The new branch is part of SIDBI's strategy to expand its presence across key MSME clusters in India. The bank plans to open a total of 24 new branches this year, aiming to reach 168 major MSME clusters by year's end. 

Beyond the Tiruchi region, this branch will also support industries in Sivakasi, Virudhnagar, Sattur, Srivilliputhur, Kovilpatti and Kalugumalai. Until a branch opens in Sivakasi, those regions will receive services through the Tiruchi and Madurai branches. 

SIDBI plans to further expand its Tamil Nadu presence with branches in Karur, Tirunelveli, and Sivakasi in the coming year. The bank aims to provide financial and developmental support to MSMEs across the state, contributing to the growth and employment potential of this vital sector.

title: Ola Electric Stock Plummets: Buy, Sell or Hold?
news:
Ola Electric's stock has fallen 44% from its record high of Rs 157.53, closing at Rs 87.46 on October 14th. The company faces challenges related to service issues and a show cause notice alleging consumer rights violations. 

Despite the drop, the stock has climbed 15% since its listing price.  

**Analysts offer mixed opinions:**

* Some experts suggest taking positions at current levels for high-risk investors with a long-term view. 
* Others recommend buying around Rs 85 with a target of Rs 95 and a strict stop loss at Rs 80.
* Technical analysts predict support at Rs 86 and resistance at Rs 90, with a potential upside towards Rs 105 if the stock closes above Rs 90.
* However, some analysts warn of a bearish trend with a potential downward target of Rs 76 if the stock closes below Rs 86.

**Key points to consider:**

* Ola Electric reported a widened net loss of Rs 347 crore in Q1 FY25.
* The company is facing service-related issues and consumer complaints.
* The EV maker has a market share of 34% in the Indian E2W market.

**Disclaimer:** This information is for educational purposes only and should not be interpreted as investment advice. Consult with a qualified financial advisor before making any investment decisions.

title: Kokrebellur: A Village Embracing Winged Beauty
news:
Nestled in Karnataka, the village of Kokrebellur, meaning "painted stork village," is a sanctuary for migratory birds, particularly painted storks and spot-billed pelicans. These majestic creatures have been visiting for decades, transforming the village into a vibrant spectacle during breeding season.

The villagers hold a deep reverence for these birds, considering them harbingers of good fortune. The "Nature Interpretation Centre," a collaborative project between WWF-India and HSBC, showcases the rich history of Kokrebellur and its unique relationship with the avian visitors.  

The centre, a treasure trove of information, reveals how the village, once situated on the banks of River Shimsha, relocated in 1916 after a plague outbreak. Remarkably, the birds followed, choosing to live near humans despite the absence of a water body. This symbiotic relationship has flourished over the years, with the village being declared a community reserve in 2007 - the only one in Karnataka. 

However, the village, like many others, faces the consequences of environmental degradation.  Wetland areas have shrunk, and agricultural land has doubled, threatening the birds' habitat.  Factors like tree felling, sand mining, and water pollution have resulted in a decline in bird populations. 

Despite these challenges, the villagers of Kokrebellur remain committed to coexisting with the birds. They actively protect them and their nests, even utilizing their droppings to produce organic manure. 

Conservation efforts, including tree planting, sustainable agriculture practices, and electrical cable insulation to prevent bird electrocution, are underway. Local communities have also established a rehabilitation centre for injured birds, showcasing their dedication to ensuring the well-being of these feathered visitors.  

Kokrebellur stands as a testament to the power of human-wildlife harmony, highlighting the importance of sustainable practices and community involvement in preserving biodiversity.

title: Indian Rupee Recovers Ground, Closes at 84.06 Against U.S. Dollar
news:
The Indian Rupee strengthened by 4 paise on Monday, October 14th, closing at 84.06 against the U.S. dollar. This marks a recovery from its all-time low, driven by robust domestic equity markets despite foreign fund outflows. 

While the strong U.S. dollar and elevated crude oil prices exerted downward pressure, the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) intervention using its record-high foreign exchange reserves helped stabilize the Rupee at lower levels.

The rupee's trading range remained narrow, fluctuating between 84.05 and 84.07 during the day. 

The positive tone of the domestic markets, however, offered some support for the Rupee. The Sensex gained 0.73% to close at 81,973.05 points, while the Nifty rose 0.66% to settle at 25,127.95 points.

Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) were net sellers in the capital markets on Friday, offloading shares worth ₹4,162.66 crore.

Despite the Rupee's recovery, concerns remain regarding foreign fund outflows and geopolitical uncertainty in the Middle East.

title: Apollo Opens Chest Pain Clinic in Visakhapatnam to Combat Cardiac Deaths
news:
Visakhapatnam, India -  Apollo Hospitals in Visakhapatnam has launched a dedicated "Apollo Chest Pain Clinic" to address the growing concern of sudden cardiac deaths. The clinic, inaugurated by Home Minister Vangalapudi Anitha on Monday, aims to provide immediate and expert medical intervention for those experiencing chest pain. 

The clinic, located at Apollo Hospitals, Arilova, offers accessible services for anyone experiencing chest pain, regardless of the severity or underlying cause.  Patients suspected of having a heart attack will receive immediate treatment, while those with non-cardiac related pain will receive reassurance and evaluation from specialists, all free of charge.

The initiative is designed to remove the financial burden associated with precautionary visits, making crucial heart care accessible to all. The clinic is equipped with cutting-edge technology and 24/7 expert care, ensuring timely treatment for heart attack patients.

D.K. Baruah, Senior Cardiologist at Apollo Hospitals, emphasized the importance of preventing loss of life due to delays in detection and treatment. “Time is critical when it comes to heart health,” he stated.

The clinics are a response to the increasing number of heart problems affecting younger populations due to lifestyle changes and the lingering effects of COVID-19. The clinics offer free emergency pick-up services within a 10 km radius of the hospital. 

This new initiative by Apollo Hospitals aims to address a critical public health issue and promote early detection and timely intervention for heart health concerns.

title: Jangamanaickenkuttai Tank Filled with Water Thanks to Corporate Funding
news:
The Jangamanaickenkuttai tank in Appanaickenpatti village, Coimbatore South Taluk, is now filled with water. This achievement, a long-held dream of the villagers, was made possible by a ₹50 lakh corporate social responsibility (CSR) initiative from Alstom.

United Way Bangalore, partnering with Alstom, studied the village's geography and devised a plan to divert water flowing on the western side to the eastern side, where the Jangamanaickenkuttai tank is located. The project involved constructing a pipeline to direct the water flow and was completed a few days ago, with the tank now 70% full.

Following heavy rainfall, the village panchayat has been using a 40 HP motor to pump water over a distance of 600 meters, filling the tank through the newly constructed pipeline.

title: Invasive Weeds Cleared in Moyar to Reduce Human-Wildlife Conflict
news:
Invasive weeds, providing hiding spots for leopards and tigers, have been cleared from an area near the Panchayat Union Middle School in Moyar, part of the Mudumalai Tiger Reserve (MTR). This initiative, led by vulture researcher Manigandan Selvaraj, aimed to mitigate negative human-animal interactions.

The clearing, covering approximately 1.5 acres, was carried out with permission from the Tamil Nadu Electricity Board (TNEB) and the Forest Department.  Funding for the operation was provided by the Evergreen Wildlife Conservation Trust and B.L. Transport.

During the clearing process, a leopard reportedly escaped from the thicket, highlighting the significance of this initiative. The removal of invasive weeds like *Lantana camara* and *Senna spectabilis* is expected to promote the growth of indigenous flora and discourage wildlife from seeking refuge near human settlements. 

With over 200 acres of exotic and invasive vegetation surrounding Moyar, further clearing operations are anticipated to further reduce human-wildlife conflict in the region.

title: India Threatens Further Action Against Canada: Diplomatic Crisis Escalates
news:
India has issued a strong warning to Canada, reserving the right to take further steps following accusations against Indian diplomats in the killing of Khalistani activist Hardeep Singh Nijjar. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) rejected Canada's allegations, calling them "concocted," and summoned the Canadian Charge d’Affaires. 

The situation has escalated following Canada's naming of Indian High Commissioner Sanjay Kumar Verma and other diplomats as "persons of interest" in the Nijjar killing. In response, India has already decided to recall Mr. Verma and five other diplomats, a move former diplomats described as necessary given the potential threat to their safety. 

Former High Commissioner to Canada Ajay Bisaria labelled Canada's actions a "needless escalation" of an already strained relationship, calling for an apology and retraction of the accusations.

India is considering a range of further measures, including:

* **Downgrading diplomatic ties:** This could involve reducing the size of the Indian High Commission in Ottawa and demanding a similar move from Canada. 
* **Economic sanctions:** India could impose tariffs on Canadian goods, scrutinize Canadian investments, and ban certain companies and apps, mirroring actions taken against China in 2020.
* **Visa restrictions:** India could suspend or restrict visas for Canadians, causing significant hardship for the diaspora, particularly those needing to return to India for family matters.
* **Flight suspensions:** Direct flights between the two countries could be cancelled, similar to the action taken against China during the COVID pandemic.

The current situation marks a significant deterioration in India-Canada relations, with both sides expelling diplomats and creating a hostile environment for diplomatic missions. The potential for further escalation remains high, and the outcome will have significant implications for the bilateral relationship.

title: India's Inflation Soars to Nine-Month High in September
news:
India's Consumer Price Index (CPI) rose to 5.49% in September, marking a nine-month high. This increase was driven primarily by soaring food prices, which jumped to 9.24% in the same period. The inflation figure surpasses the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) target of 4%. 

The food inflation, which accounts for roughly half of the CPI basket, saw a significant jump from 5.66% in August. This rise is attributed to a steep increase in vegetable prices, which recorded a 48.73% inflation rate in September. 

The wholesale price inflation (WPI) also rose to 1.84% in September, further indicating rising prices. This increase is largely attributed to the rising cost of food items, particularly vegetables.

The CPI for August had reached a five-year low of 3.65%.

title: Ratan Tata's Legacy: Who Inherits His Fortune?
news:
Ratan Tata, the renowned former chairman of the Tata Group, passed away on October 9th, 2024, at the age of 86. His net worth, estimated at Rs 7,900 crore (approximately $980 million), has sparked speculation about who will inherit his fortune.

Tata's wealth largely stemmed from his 0.83% stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group. Additionally, he made numerous investments through his private investment vehicle, RNT Associates, in companies like Ola, Paytm, and Urban Company.

One potential heir is Noel Tata, Ratan Tata's half-brother. Noel has been increasingly involved in Tata Trusts following Ratan's passing, serving as a trustee of the Sir Ratan Tata Trust and the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust. His growing role suggests he may eventually gain control of these organizations.

While it remains unclear who will inherit Ratan Tata's personal wealth, it is likely that his legacy, marked by humility and philanthropic endeavors through Tata Trusts, will continue to shape the future of the Tata Group.

title: "Do Patti" Trailer: A Twin Twist in a Murder Mystery
news:
The highly anticipated trailer for "Do Patti" dropped on October 14th, showcasing a thrilling murder mystery set in Manali. The film stars Kajol as a detective investigating a complex case, alongside Kriti Sanon, who plays twin sisters with drastically different personalities. 

The trailer reveals a love triangle, with Saumya (Kriti) falling for Dhruv (Shaheer Sheikh) before her enigmatic twin, Shailee, enters the picture, disrupting their relationship.  The mystery deepens when Dhruv is arrested for attempted murder.

title: Third Suspect in Baba Siddique Murder Case Sent to Police Custody
news:
Pravin Lonkar, brother of Shubham Lonkar, the alleged mastermind behind the murder of former Maharashtra Minister Baba Siddique, was sent to police custody till October 21. Lonkar was arrested on Sunday, October 13, marking the third arrest in the case. 

The police suspect that Lonkar, who is being investigated for his connection to the Bishnoi gang, may have provided weapons to the shooters. They also believe that he holds crucial information about the six suspects involved in the murder. 

The defense lawyer argued that Lonkar was being made a "scapegoat" and had no involvement in the crime. He further stated that Lonkar was unaware of his brother's intentions and was arrested at his home. 

The murder of Baba Siddique, a prominent NCP leader, sparked outrage across Maharashtra. The incident has also raised questions about the security measures in place for politicians and the government's response to the threats received by Siddique. 

The investigation continues as police seek to apprehend the remaining suspects, including the alleged mastermind, Shubham Lonkar.

title: HCLTech Q2 FY25 Results: Profit Rises 11%, Revenue Climbs 8%
news:
HCL Technologies (HCLTech) reported a strong second quarter performance, with net profit jumping 10.52% to Rs 4,235 crore compared to Rs 3,832 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations increased by 8.21% to Rs 28,862 crore, up from Rs 26,672 crore in the previous year.

The company's constant currency (CC) revenue, USD revenue, and INR revenue all saw year-on-year (YoY) growth of 6.2%, 6.8%, and 8.2% respectively.  HCLTech narrowed its revenue growth forecast for the fiscal year to 3.5%-5%, down from the previous 3%-5%.

EBIT stood at Rs 5,362 crore (18.6% of revenue), representing an 8.7% YoY increase.  The company's total headcount reached 2,18,621 with net additions of 780 employees, including 2,932 freshers hired in the September quarter. Attrition rate decreased to 12.9% from 14.2% in the previous year.  New deal wins reached $2,218 million.

The HCLTech board declared an interim dividend of Rs 12 for FY25, with a record date set for October 22, 2024 and payment on October 30, 2024.

HCLTech chairperson Roshni Nadar Malhotra stated their commitment to sustainable and responsible growth. The company has focused on upskilling employees in next-generation technologies to better serve clients.  Their global community engagement footprint continues to expand.

HCLTech shares closed 0.89% higher at Rs 1,856 on the day of the announcement.

title: Delhi Cab Driver's "Rules" Spark Debate:  Respect or Control?
news:
A Delhi cab driver's list of "rules" for passengers, posted on his vehicle, has ignited a heated discussion online. The driver's six guidelines include requests for polite behavior, gentle door closing, and avoiding the term "bhaiya". Notably, he emphasizes that he owns the vehicle and that passengers should not expect him to drive recklessly to meet their deadlines.

The driver's request for respect has garnered support from some, who see it as setting clear boundaries and maintaining a professional environment. Others criticize the rules as overly strict and unreasonable, arguing that passengers should be free to enjoy their ride without feeling judged. 

The most controversial rule prohibits calling the driver "bhaiya".  While some understand the driver's desire for professionalism, others argue that casual language is acceptable as long as respect is mutual.

This incident highlights a growing tension in service industries: the balance between customer expectations and service provider boundaries. While the driver's rules sparked debate, they raise the important question of how to foster a culture of mutual respect within transportation services.
